title.narrative: Consultations régionales en vue de l'élaboration du plan stratégique du CRDI pour la période allant de 2015 à 2020
Regional Consultations: Strategic Considerations for IDRC's 2015-2020 Strategic Plan

description.narrative: IDRC is developing a new strategic plan for 2015-2020. To ensure that the strategy reflects and responds to the changing nature and priorities of research-for-development in the regions where it works, IDRC will convene four regional consultations. This project will fund the consultations. The consultations will be held in the four regions where IDRC has offices: Latin America and the Caribbean, Middle East and North Africa, Asia, and sub-Saharan Africa. They will bring together between 10 to 15 representatives from research, development, policy, and the private sector. The regional consultations will help identify emerging opportunities and risks, inform IDRC's program directions, and ensure that the organization continues to invest in research that is relevant and at the forefront of evolving development challenges. More specifically, the consultations will aim to: -produce four summary reports and one consolidated report for IDRC senior management to help inform the strategic plan; -bring together experts and representatives from various sectors and stakeholder groups to broaden IDRC's knowledge of new opportunities; -identify risks related to the regional or global context; and, -promote IDRC's visibility and grow its regional networks across research, development, policy, and the private sectors.
